intro: Rochelia disperma var. microcalycina, commonly known as the small-calyx rochelia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant features slender, branching stems covered with fine, hairy foliage. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in dense, daisy-like clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands or open woodlands.
